page.title: 16EXPLORING THE SELSFIELD AREA
page.content: Many well-signposted footpaths provide a variety of walks, crossing farmlands and woods, sometimes with extensive views. The path opposite{Selsfield {Common,}across undulating farmland to {Little Strudgate Farm,}gives fine views of the{South Downs}and {Chanctonbury Ring.}At{Great Strudgate {Farm}a path branches off to pass{Old {House,}formerly{Fieldwyck,}where the family of that name lived for many centuries. The registered herd of {Guernsey}cows bears the name{Feldwick. On the opposite side of the road is the{White Hart Inn,}an attractive half timbered coaching inn beside the former turnpike, dating from the 14th century. It was a hunting lodge for {John of Gaunt.}Today it provides good food as well as drink.
